intro: Macronema × bolanderi, commonly known as the Bolander's macronema, is a hybrid plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its hybrid origin, it exhibits a range of morphological variations in its natural habitat.
